Member Function Documentation

int ORHeader::GetDataId ( std::string  dataObjPath  )  const [virtual]

Returns a dataID given the object path.

Orca headers contain the following construction: 

        <key>dataDescription</key>
        <dict>
        ...
            <key>AnObject</key>
            <dict>
            ...
                <key>DataFromObject</key>
                <dict>
                    <key>dataId</key>
                    <integer>9909</integer>
 
        ...
To find the dataId in this case, one would call: GetDataId( "AnObject:DataFromObject" );

However, the OrcaROOT framework automatically handles this and this function should generally not need to be called by the user.

This function is called with the return argument of ORVDataDecoder::GetDataObjectPath();

See also ORDataProcessor.

Definition at line 29 of file ORHeader.cc.
